meanings.definition: Verify the accuracy of (information) by using multiple sources or methods.
meanings.sent1: She always crosschecks her research to make sure it is correct.
meanings.sent2: He crosschecks the data from different websites before drawing any conclusions.
meanings.sent3: The detective crosschecks the suspect's alibi with witness statements.
meanings.sent4: Crosschecking the facts is like putting together a puzzle to see the whole picture.
meanings.sent5: Crosschecks help us catch mistakes and ensure our work is precise.

meanings.definition: A check or restraint on the actions of another.
meanings.sent1: The new policy serves as a crosscheck on the manager's decisions.
meanings.sent2: The legal system acts as a crosscheck to prevent abuse of power.
meanings.sent3: The referee's whistle serves as a crosscheck to keep the game fair.
meanings.sent4: In a way, rules are like crosschecks that guide our behavior.
meanings.sent5: A crosscheck acts as a safety net to prevent errors and ensure accountability.
